A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I'll start off by saying I'm not a huge Star Wars fan. I've watched the films when I was young and watched the 7th one at the cinema. However\,this film was great and I will definitely re-watch it. It's got exactly what you would expect from a Star Wars film;it's got plenty of action\,twists and turns and a certain sci-fi element to it. However\,this one improves on episode 7 in a lot of ways-one of the best examples is making me like Ben (a character who I didn't like) \nAlthough a lot of things in the film felt forced (no pun intended) one huge one example that comes to mind is -SPOILER WARNING-killing off Luke in the cheapest way possible-like I said before\,I'm not a huge Star Wars fan so it didn't impact me as much as others. Which is a shame because I was beginning to like the older Luke...\nOverall it's a great film\,but killing off Lule in such a cheap way just screams that it wants to reboot the series. As a grade I'd give it an A-
